subject: Acceptance of GST Audit Report and Payment of GST to the Contractors & Concessionaires under Change in Law and Clarification against regular monthly payment of GST to the Consultants/Contractors/Service providers/other Vendors - reg.

No. 90954)} Sub: Acceptance of GST Audit Report and Payment of GST to the Contractors & Concessionaires under Change in Law and Clarification against regular monthly payment of GST to the Consultants/Contractors/Service providerslother Vendors reg: This  guideline is issued in supersession  of earlier  guideline vide Policy Circular No. 3.3.31/ 2024 dated 16.05.2024. 1 _ Acceptance of GST Audit Report and Payment of GST to the Contractors & Concessionaires under Change-in-Law: With the implementation of GST Act, 2017 Concessionaires/ Contractors are responsible for discharging the liability of GST under Change-in-Law. (a) Time line for GST Audit: Interim- One month, Final-One month & PEER- Fifteen (15) Concessionaires/ Contractors should submit the information/ documents to the GST Auditor immediately so as to complete the GST Audit within the above timelines. In order to streamline the process for acceptance of GST Audit Report as communicated by NHAI HQ to respective PIUs and payment of GST under Change in Law to the Concessionaires/ Contractors,  following methodology shall be strictly followed by PIUs. (b) Methodology: After completion of the GST Audit (Interim/Final) , the GST audit report shall be forwarded to the Concessionaires/ Contractors for acceptance of the Audit Report: Contractors & Concessionaires shall submit their acceptance within seven (7) days. Once the acceptance received from Concessionaires/ Contractors, In Principle Approval' of the Competent Authority shall be obtained by GST Cell, NHAI HQ, within next 3 working days. After getting 'In Principle Approval' , letter will be issued to PIU with GST Audit   Report immediately. (ii) Based on the Auditors' Reports, ad-hoc payment of 90% shall be released by the PIU as per the Concession/ Contract Agreement and the extant delegation of powers (as per para 8.4.2 & 8.4.3 of Delegation of Power mentioned under NHAI Policy Circular 18.24/2017 dated 21.08.2017) within next   three (3) working days, including time taken by RO for giving approval, If any, from the date of submission of claim by the Contractors/ Concessionaires.
